image.altText: A sketch of a woman with long brown hair in a purple top frowning in front of a cream backdrop.

props.synopsis: For more than a week, accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson protested her innocence from the witness box in her Supreme Court murder trial.

title.children: What Patterson told jury during eight days in witness box

image.altText: Four people sit close together as they pose for a picture.

props.synopsis: A defence lawyer tells jurors they cannot right the wrongs of Victoria's youth during the trial of a man accused of murdering a Box Hill doctor.

title.children: Court hears boys left fatally wounded GP lying lifeless on ground

image.altText: A portrait photo of Katie Tangey, who is smiling, against a colourful floral background.

props.synopsis: Police have raided a home in Melbourne's south-east after an arson attack killed a 27-year-old woman in January.

title.children: Items seized in search of home linked to 'tobacco war' fatal arson attack

image.altText: Monash IVF sign

props.synopsis: The move was announced on the ASX this morning.

title.children: Monash IVF CEO quits after second embryo bungle

image.altText: Liberal party MP Moira Deeming exits from a joint party meeting, wearing a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Independent Broad-based Anti-Corruption Commission has been asked to investigate Moira Deeming's offer to delay bankruptcy proceedings against John Pesutto.

title.children: Moira Deeming referred to corruption investigators over John Pesutto offer

image.altText: An elderly woman and man, who is in a wheelchair, in their living room.

props.synopsis: Clients of aged and disability care service Annecto say they have not been told who will be taking its place.

title.children: Sudden closure of major care provider leaves thousands scrambling

image.altText: The GrainCorp factory in Numurkah emitting smoke.

props.synopsis: Numurkah residents launch a class action against manufacturer GrainCorp Oilseeds, alleging noise and odour pollution that residents say has affected their health and wellbeing.

title.children: Class action alleges noise and odour pollution by small town's main employer

image.altText: An elderly woman holding a newspaper.

props.synopsis: Newspapers founded in the 1800s in Shepparton and Echuca are to be reduced to twice-weekly editions, McPherson Media Group announces, disappointing loyal readers.

title.children: Seniors lament news 'feel' as historic regional mastheads cut print run

image.altText: GettyImages-1775360018

props.synopsis: Tom Harley's AFL career almost only lasted for one game. Now, the former Port and Geelong player has become one of the most important people in footy.

title.children: How an almost one-game wonder traded up to hold the keys to AFL House

image.altText: A small dragon-like lizard with green and dark green scales and yellow and white highlights, but no earhole.

props.synopsis: The home of the only wild population of Victorian grassland earless dragons is no longer viable as a private farm, but governments are unwilling to buy the land for conservation.

title.children: Once thought dead, this lizard faces extinction from land sale limbo

image.altText: Joanne Ciconte with the visor on her helmet lifted, looking into the distance

props.synopsis: Joanne Ciconte is the first Australian to score championship points in F1's all-female category, the first of potentially many accolades for the teenager.

title.children: Aussie teen creating history while settling into life in the fast lane

image.altText: Seven TV hosts all smiling warmly wearing reasonably formal clothing with a blue, pink and orange background

props.synopsis: The end of The Project "signals the end of so much more" says host Waleed Aly, who says the show will leave a hole in the television landscape "that won't be filled".

title.children: 'Astonished I got to do this': The Project host reflects on show's axing

image.altText: A sign on a building says Papilio early learning.

props.synopsis: Victoria's minister for children says the state's childcare regulator is "actively monitoring" provider Affinity Education after allegations against it, including a child being hit by a staff member, were aired in NSW parliament.

title.children: Victorian childcare regulator 'monitoring' provider at centre of NSW allegations

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with long brown hair in a purple top frowning in front of a cream backdrop.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson has told a Supreme Court jury that she fed her children the leftovers of a deadly beef Wellington lunch despite experiencing diarrhoea after eating it.

title.children: Accused killer Erin Patterson fed children lunch leftovers despite illness, court told

image.altText: A woman's hand clasps an elderly person's had as it rests on a crocheted blanket.

props.synopsis: Annecto, which employs about 1,000 people and has 4,400 clients on its books, has announced it will close next month.

title.children: Major aged care and disability support service set to close

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal MP Moira Deeming offers to delay bankruptcy proceedings against former leader John Pesutto if the opposition party bypasses its rules and guarantees her preselection for next year's state election.

title.children: Deeming offers to delay Pesutto bankruptcy proceedings for preselection

image.altText: Mary-Anne Thomas has brown chin length hair and wears a green, white and black patterned top and dark round glasses.

props.synopsis: Mildura Base Public Hospital's board says the hospital needs more support as its capacity challenges become "more urgent by the day".

title.children: Inquiry hears health minister has 'concerns' over Mildura hospital

image.altText: Three workers, one in white overalls and the others in orange and yellow high vis, look at a gap in the road with metal spikes.

props.synopsis: Traffic has reopened on the Princes Freeway after a truck rollover damaged cars and left commuters stuck in traffic for hours.

title.children: Hours-long traffic delays in Melbourne's west as crews inspect road damage

image.altText: A black and white printed photo strips of a man with glasses and wavy hair.

props.synopsis: For 50 years and before his death earlier this year, Alan Adler worked alone to keep the historic Flinders Street Station photo booth up and running.

title.children: Alan Adler worked alone for 50 years to keep Melbourne's photo booths open

image.altText: GettyImages-2218916853

props.synopsis: Erin Phillips and Daisy Pearce's contribution to football in Australia go further than the years they played in the AFLW.

title.children: Why Phillips and Pearce's contribution to footy goes far beyond the field

image.altText: GettyImages-2218919868

props.synopsis: Erin Phillips and Daisy Pearce become the first AFLW players to be inducted into the Australian Football Hall of Fame.

title.children: Footy star's emotional Hall of Fame speech leaves father in tears

image.altText: White football, labelled "A-Leagues 2024/25," lying beside a white boundary line on a grass pitch.

props.synopsis: The professional soccer players' association calls for gambling on yellow cards to be banned in the wake of the A-League's second match fixing scandal in 12 months.

title.children: Soccer players demand ban on betting on yellow cards

image.altText: A family stands next to a dam with some water in it on a farm.

props.synopsis: Victorian farmers breathed a sigh of relief across the weekend as much-needed rain fell across the state.

title.children: 'Grinning our heads off': Farmers ecstatic after much-needed rains

image.altText: Police Senior Sergeant Luke Banwell

props.synopsis: Police say an 18-year-old male driver and and his 15-year-old male passenger were in a car that lost control on a wet road then hit a tree.

title.children: Two teenagers killed in crash at Orbost in Victoria's east

image.altText: REA logo outside their office is of a red and white arrow going up

props.synopsis: It can cost thousands to list a property online for sale. The competition regulator has stepped in after years of complaints that REA Group is using its dominant position to the detriment of home sellers and real estate agents.

title.children: 'Complete market saturation': Real estate listings giant faces probe

image.altText: McLaren's Lando Norris, McLaren's Oscar Piastri, Red Bull's Max Verstappen and drivers in action at the start of the race.

props.synopsis: Formula 1's new era will begin in Melbourne after the Australian Grand Prix was confirmed as the first race of the 2026 season.

title.children: F1's new era to begin at Australian Grand Prix with first race of 2026

image.altText: A flowering tobacco plant in a field.

props.synopsis: Authorities seize a 20-tonne crop of mature tobacco being grown on 2.4 hectares, an area equivalent to more than 100 tennis courts, in Victoria's north.

title.children: Illicit tobacco crop worth $4.4m discovered near Shepparton after tip-off

image.altText: A Rolled over car

props.synopsis: Emergency services spent the weekend rescuing people trapped in cars in Victoria's high country. Here's how to stay safe up the mountain.

title.children: How to avoid getting your car stuck on snowy roads this winter

image.altText: A woman in a lab coat holds a blood sample in a laboratory.

props.synopsis: Patients have to eat gluten for weeks before the current coeliac disease test, even when it makes them ill, but Australian researchers believe they have found a better method.

title.children: 'Life-changing' test developed for people allergic to gluten

image.altText: A male ABC presenter stands behind a table in a hay shed. He's wearing headphones and is hoping a microphone.

props.synopsis: Victorian Country Hour host Warwick Long reflects on how farmers focus on mental health, modern farming practices and climate change preparation.

title.children: Victoria is in the grip of drought, but what's different about this one?

image.altText: Bushwalkers were stranded in wild weather near Mt Kosciuszko

props.synopsis: Hikers visiting the alps are being urged to take the necessary precautions after a series of rescues in NSW and Victoria.

title.children: Couple stranded in blizzard rescued in 20-hour operation

image.altText: A best before sticker on the bottom of a jar of preserved blueberries.

props.synopsis: Australian households could be tossing perfectly good food away because of unclear best before and use-by dates.

title.children: Australians are throwing out $2,500 worth of food before it goes off

image.altText: A woman clasps her hand in front of her face in front of a mirror

props.synopsis: Last year, more than 1,700 orders for involuntary electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) were approved by tribunals in Australia. Advocacy groups say clinicians need to be better informed.

title.children: Thousands of Australians receiving ECT without consent every year

image.altText: A black and brown puppy held by a boy

props.synopsis: Downpours during the Australian Kelpie Muster bring smiles, not scowls, to a drought-stricken town in western Victoria.

title.children: Tails wag at kelpie muster as rain drenches town ravaged by drought

image.altText: Two men wrestle on inside a UFC octagon. Seen through the wire of its fence, one man straddles the other.

props.synopsis: Beneath the profitable success story of the UFC lies a hidden reality: many athletes who have dedicated their careers to the sport are struggling and are unable to fight back.

title.children: Tyson was 'willing to die' for the UFC. He changed his mind after getting paid
